article.headline: Oregon 73, USC 61
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- The USC Trojans were primed for a letdown after an emotional win over UCLA last weekend, and the Oregon Ducks were ready to take advantage. Aaron Brooks scored 20 points and Malik Hairston got 16 of his 18 points in the final 12 minutes, leading Oregon to a 73-61 victory USC on Thursday night. "It's like when we beat Arizona and then came back and lost to Arizona State. We just didn't come out with the fire that we normally come out with," USC's Nick Young said. "I didn't come out ready tonight. We're coming towards the end of the our season and we don't have the fresh legs that we had before, so we've got to do other things out there." Ray Schaefer added 13 points for the Ducks (13-15, 6-9 Pac-10), who eclipsed last season's conference win total and beat USC for the seventh time in the last eight meetings. Ryan Francis scored 18 points for USC (16-10, 7-8). Young finished with 14. Gabe Pruitt, who scored 30 points in an 84-78 win over Oregon at Eugene on Jan. 28, missed his fourth straight game because of a fracture in his left knee. "I thought defense was certainly a big key in the game," Oregon coach Ernie Kent said. "We had some big stops down the stretch. The whole key was to keep Nick Young between 10 and 14 points. We did a good job of containing a great player." Oregon was coming off a 67-37 blowout of Washington State in Saturday's home finale -- the Ducks' best defensive effort against a conference opponent since the NCAA instituted the 45-second shot clock in 1985. The Ducks could get a first-round bye in next month's Pac-10 tournament by finishing sixth or better. Oregon is currently seventh in the conference, a half-game behind USC. The Trojans, who pulled a dramatic 71-68 upset over 19th-ranked UCLA on Sunday, could never get untracked against the Ducks in the second half Thursday night. Hairston, who shot 2-for-9 with just eight points in the two teams' previous meeting, scored 13 points during a 5:46 span of the second half as the Ducks extended their lead to 61-53 with 7:46 remaining. His last three baskets during that stretch were from 3-point range. "He knew Aaron and Malik Hairston were going to come out hard tonight because we kind of shut them down the last time," USC guard Lodrick Stewart said. "They were getting it down lot and pounding it, and they were making their 3-point shots. So it was kind of hard for us to get stops. Their whole team played together tonight." Schaefer had briefly put the Ducks in a bind when he picked up two offensive fouls in the first 2:05. But the 7-foot sophomore didn't get another foul the rest of the game and scored nine consecutive Oregon points during a 2:58 span to help give his team a 41-36 lead with 15:10 to play. USC narrowed the gap to 61-57, with Francis scoring nine points during a 4:20 span, but Oregon closed with a 10-2 run. Brooks hit a 3-pointer with 4 seconds left in the first half, ending a 9-2 run that gave Oregon a 30-27 lead at intermission. USC's Dwayne Shackleford, a reserve guard who was instrumental in the win over UCLA, made a pair of 3-point baskets 50 seconds apart for a 25-21 lead with 4:26 left in the half. USC, which has called the Sports Arena its home since 1959, will play there for the final time on Saturday night against Oregon State. The Trojans will move into their new home, the Galen Center, next season. "This building has been great for us. We've had a lot of great games here," Kent said. "I know next year, their building on campus is going to be a much tougher environment."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
